text: <@U0P60390X|aleks> has joined the channel
I just upgraded to AS 2, and it brooke my instrumentation and unit test -> duplicate class
It seems my build flavors broke. Any1 knows how to fix this?
I think it’s because it merges them in 2.0
(the build variant switcher doesn’t have test variant there anymore)
Yes, I noticed.
you can disable that in preferences.
So there is no more androidTest and test?
The merge?
prefs -> build -> build tools -> experimental -> untick that box about the tests
that should do it :simple_smile:
I found it working well for new projects, but breaking our current app.
Yeah, I’d prefer to keep it separate for my current projects.
Thanks :+1:
no prob

text: check the approved answer
maybe that's your problem
Anyone know of a way to disable recyclerview scrolling for only one direction?
Like in a middle of a list, you can now only scroll further down
Alternatively a way to stop a scrollview from scrolling completely, even when inheriting scroll events from the recyclerview

What I am trying to accomplish is basically a recyclerview in a scrollview, but the scrollview won’t scroll from any touch events, only programmatically. But in the current implementation, if i keep scrolling up above the recyclerview, the scrollview eats it and scrolls itself from the touch event.

<@U0H67LJUA>: checkout this <http://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v7/widget/RecyclerView.html#addOnScrollListener(android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.OnScrollListener)> and this <http://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v7/widget/RecyclerView.html#onInterceptTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent)> . They might do what you are looking for
Been using those the last hours, seems promising, but have not gotten it to work yet, but thanks :simple_smile:

<@U0H67LJUA>: you just have to steal the touch events and do nothing with them. This seems to be almost exactly what you are looking for <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30531091/how-to-disable-recyclerview-scrolling>

attachments.title: How to disable RecyclerView scrolling?
attachments.text: I cannot disable scrolling in the RecyclerView. I tried calling rv.setEnabled(false) but I can still scroll. How can I disable scrolling?

text: onInterceptTouchEvent seems perfect for this case, but does not appear to do anything for me
did you add the listener to your RecyclerView ?
That could work
yeah
Seems like I get stuck in the same place, I have to disable scroll for only one direction. Maybe there is a scroll boundary or something, I’ll keep looking.
You could always calculate which direction the scroll was with the touchEvents
Yeah, but that causes the same problem. I know when I should not scroll, but I can’t find a way to restrict it instead of disabling it.
guys anyone willing to help me with my scenario

Going by the SO question I posted before you would have a `RecyclerView.OnItemTouchListener disabler = new RecyclerViewDisabler();`. Let's say you want to disable when scrolling downwards, what you have to do is to listen for scroll events with `RecyclerView.OnScrollListener` and when the `dx` is increased then you disable scrolling with `recyclerView.addOnItemTouchListener(disabler);`

How do I open an activity and enter text into one of the `EditText,` on click of a button?
What have you done so far
I'm opening an activity
a borwser actually
with an url
If you’re opening a browser, then its out of your hands
If you want to show them a website while still being in control, use a `WebView`
execute javascript in a webview?
Hmm
let's say I'd like to enter some text into google search box and hit enter

You can’t do that with your current implementation
Your current intent opens the browser, _another_ android application.  There’s nothing you can do.
If you want to do what you’re saying, start by loading google in a `WebView` instead
Inside of your own application
cool
from webView I can find elements and enter text?
I don't think so =)
Yes, on a webview you can add a JavaScript interface, or just evaluate javascript
So if you know the IDs of what you’re looking for (look at google source for the input id for example), you can set the text
ah, that way
cool..thanks a lot :simple_smile:

`webView.evaluateJavascript(String script, ValueCallback<String> resultCallback);`
`webView.addJavascriptInterface(Object object, String name);`

^^ 2 methods you might want to look into that could be useful
